text:
Roseanne is back on Tuesday, May 1st on ABC at 8:00 p.m. with a new episode titled "No Country For Old Women." Here's the synopsis:

After Beverly gets kicked out of the nursing home, Roseanne and Jackie fight over who will take care of their mother. Meanwhile, Mark’s creative touch with building a birdhouse for Dan’s customer is more than Dan can handle, but Darlene defends her son.

Roseanne originally aired on ABC from 1988 to 1997, hit No. 1 in the Nielsen ratings in 1990, and stayed in the top four across six of its nine seasons. It earned praise for its depiction of blue collar America, its hardworking parents, and its commitment to tackling social issues.

The series captured Emmy wins for Barr and Metcalf. John Goodman was nominated seven times, but did not win for Outstanding Lead Actor.

Roseanne Season 10 Episode 6 Trailer

Video of Roseanne 10x06 Promo "No Country for Old Women" (HD)

Roseanne Reboot Episodes

ABC released the titles for the first three episodes of the Roseanne revival.

Episode 1: "Twenty Years to Life"

Episode 2: "Dress to Impress"

Episode 3: "Roseanne Gets The Chair"

Episode 4: "Eggs Over, Not Easy"

Episode 5: "Netflix & Pill"

Roseanne Reboot Trailers

Check out the trailers!

Video of Roseanne (ABC) Trailer #2 "Feel The Love" - Roseanne Season 10

Video of Roseanne (ABC) "The Conners Are Back" Trailer #3 HD - Roseanne Season 10

Roseanne Reboot Release Date

The Roseanne revival will begin airing with an hour-long special on March 27th. The series will air in its regular timeslot beginning Tuesday, April 3rd at 8:00 p.m.

Roseanne Reboot Cast

Roseanne Barr, John Goodman, Sara Gilbert, Laurie Metcalf, Michael Fishman and Lecy Goranson are all set to return. Johnny Galecki and Sarah Chalke will also reprise their roles.
